posts.post_content:
This guy is a house! He's an infect deck all by his lonesome!  
  
He totally takes down his older brother, the original eldrazi, [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus)!  
  
If there's some wonky haste giving-[Shape Anew](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shape Anew) deck out there, expect to see this guy a lot!

Posted By: hakarl (1/27/2011 6:21:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm seeing a lot of negative comments directed at R&D for this card. My personal opinion is that R&D makes cards that are cool, look scary, and are not OP more than the next mythic. There are TONS of other giant creatures that have "I kill you in one hit" written all over them. Cruel Ultimatum, Phage, Myr Battlesphere, and Emrakul are all examples of these, but should they not have been printed? OF COURSE NOT. Any format that can reliably abuse this already has a billion other things that can be abused. I'm looking at you, vintage.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I'm seeing a lot negative comments towards this guy.
  
"Oh blahblahblah [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason) blah."
  
"No way to get him out, unreliable, blah."
  
Boring.
  
Guys, this is turning the Poly/Emrakul (which is a pretty solid deck) into Shape/Blightsteel.
  
And you're worried about it being taken care of?
  
[Turn Aside](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turn Aside) is pretty solid, as is the now-classic [Mana Leak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Leak).
  
No, no, no, this guy is a house, and there are plenty of ways to have him reliably win,
  
And I'm just talking standard.
  
Going into other formats, he'll be even more of a threat.

posts.post_content: To be honest, this card is at times worse than Darksteel. It has no synergy in many decks that would run Darksteel because the rest of your deck is usually relying on damage. Darksteel deals damage, this guy deals poison counters. Poison Counters are much easier to manage if there's only one source of em.

posts.post_content:
Completely ridiculous. Once this hits vintage tinker will be even less fun to play against. Boo for bad card design MaRo.   
  
That said, this card is insanely good. Body as big as its mana cost -1. Indestructible. *Infect*. The shuffling thing is more of a drawback than it is a benefit in my eyes, but it can have its uses. It deserves a 5/5 rating. It also deserves to not have been made.
posts.html:
Completely ridiculous. Once this hits vintage tinker will be even less fun to play against. Boo for bad card design MaRo.

That said, this card is insanely good. Body as big as its mana cost -1. Indestructible. Infect. The shuffling thing is more of a drawback than it is a benefit in my eyes, but it can have its uses. It deserves a 5/5 rating. It also deserves to not have been made.

posts.post_content:
The best target for [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason) in the game period. No, you're not going to see people waiting around to give this sucker haste. Yes, red decks are going to run a playset of creature stealers from now on. Nothing says win like poisoning someone to death with a deck that doesn't even have infect creatures or spells.  
  
{BR} Vamps is just going to nab this for a turn, swing, possibly win, if not just feed it to [Bloodthrone Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodthrone Vampire) to \*\*\* people off.
